result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin D Royster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin D Royster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.
   
Defendant sentenced to serve 125 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction. This time is stayed pending agents discretion.
     *   Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication.
     *   Take all medication as prescribed.
     *   No contact with Target on 85th and Browndeer Road.
     *   Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, including DNA sucharge, to be paid by the end of probation or civil judgment.  
     *   Restitution set at ZERO. 

Filed;
- Notice of RIght to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Pretrial Incarceration Credit;

Defendant Devin D Royster in court with attorney Adam c Essling.    Student Intern Derek Waterstreet under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 2:   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

Defendant Devin D Royster in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Milwaukee County Target

Defendant Devin D Royster in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Devin D Royster in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Devin D Royster
Current: 2937 W Glendale Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 02-13-2015)
Prior: 1820 West Wells Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
